description:
All my teenage life I found myself on antidepressants, anxiolytics, and stomach/reflux meds as I battled anorexia (and would sometimes purge). Multiple endoscopies and a colonoscopy later, I came back positive at 17 for Barrett’s esophagus. ⁣
⁣
Barrett’s esophagus involves abnormal changes in the cells lining the esophagus and Can be precancerous. Prior to that diagnosis, I had been on years of proton pump inhibitors medications and literally was starving myself 🥴⁣
⁣
Proton pump inhibitors (PPIs) are medications that suppress gastric acid production - such as Nexium, Prevaid, Prisolec and Protonix. They are known for the following adverse effects:⁣
⁣
✅ induce magnesium and iron deficiency⁣
✅ increased fracture risk⁣
✅ increased risk of SIBO⁣
✅ increased risk of serious gut infections such as Campylobacter and Clostridium difficile⁣
✅ facilitated gut dysbiosis⁣
✅ increased risk of death (and recent studies show increased stroke risk ⁣
✅ increased risk of micronutrient deficiency, especially B vitamins ⁣
⁣
It wasn’t until I found the book Gut and Psychology Syndrome by Dr Natasha McBride that I realized how much my gut health was affecting my mental state...even the eating disorder. That began my path of integrative medicine and healing a leaky gut ❤️⁣
⁣
Next week I’ll be doing a free workshop where you can learn about leaky gut, resources and tools to support healing, essential oils and supplements I have used to help and nutrition tips. I would love to have you join. Our healing is critical ...and it’s critical we share it ❤️ Learn more in my stories or let me know below if you need an invite 👋🏿👋🏼👋🏽👋🏾⁣
